intro: Conyza viminea, commonly known as slenderleaf horseweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields. Its small, white to yellowish flowers bloom in clusters, and the leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs. Conyza viminea is known for its rapid growth and ability to spread through wind-dispersed seeds.
